crazyballrun.game.level.controllers

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.level.controllers.ObjectController
      • crazyballrun.game.level.controllers.Player

  • public class Player
extends ObjectController
    The Player class simply represents a link between camera and vehicle. The player updates according to its vehicle's position. In addition, the Player class supports internal force generation on the vehicle as well as weapon usage.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Player.Action
      Enumeration of all possible player-actions.

      • control

        public void control(double dt)
        Description copied from class: ObjectController
        This method is called by the PhysicsThread. The implementation should perform actions (apply forces, torques or use weapons, for example) for the LevelObject.
        Specified by:
        control in class ObjectController
        Parameters:
        dt - time passed since the last call (in seconds)

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from class: ObjectController
        Sets one property. This method is used by the LevelObjectParser to support implementation specific data (e.g. if the control uses waypoints, it needs the position of them, if the control evaluates it's next goal position by heuristic values, they may be specified here).
        Specified by:
        setProperty in class ObjectController
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property
        value - value for the property

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.util.ArrayList<GraphGenerator> graphs,
              PathFinder pathfinder)
        Description copied from class: ObjectController
        Initializes the ObjectController after setting all properties. This method is automatically called and must be overwritten by subclasses. The method gives access to a pathfinding-algorithm and the corresponding graphs (one for each layer). This may be used for AIs/NPCs to get the appropriate path to their goals.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class ObjectController
        Parameters:
        graphs - reference to the GraphGenerators (which already generated the graph (use getNode()-method to find nodes at particular positions)
        pathfinder - reference to the PathFinder - give him a start- and goal-node and he returns the shortest path
